citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ignicoccus pacificus sp. nov. (Huber and Stetter)
Ignicoccus pacificus (pa.ci'fi.cus. M.L. masc. adj. pacificus from the Pacific, pertaining to the site of its
Slightly irregular cocci, about 1-2 μm in diameter, monopolar polytrichous flagella.
No evidence for a regular arrayed surface protein.
Growth between 75 and 98 °C, pH 4.5-7.0 and 1.0-5.0%NaCl; optima are 90 °C, pH 6 and 2% NaCl.
Chemolithoautotrophic growth in the presence of H2 and CO2 with sulfur as electron acceptor.
No chemo-organotrophic growth on meat extract, yeast extract, peptone, Casamino acids, gelatin, starch, formate, acetate or glucose.
Sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate, tetrathionate and nitrate are not used as electron acceptors.
Growth stimulated by addition of 0.1% meat extract, tryptone, gelatin or yeast extract.
No significant DNA-DNA similarity to Ignicoccus islandicus.
Type strain is isolate LPC33T(=DSM 13166T=ATCC 700958T), isolated from black smoker samples at 9° N, 104° W in the Pacific Ocean.
